p: 4. Our “essence” is ex-sistence: having to become our own being. The being☞ to which☞ I can and in fact always do relate to in one way or another is what we call Existenz.n We are not a “what” [i.e., we do not have an “essence” in the traditional sense]. Rather, our “essence,” our inevitable way of being, consists in ex-sisting, i.e., having to become our being as our own. We are ex-sistence [Dasein], which expresses the fact that our being is ours to become.
